task.summary: Default task

Rename from Window.java/Window.form to AppWindow.java/AppWindow.form. Add JComboBox for new feature: Choosing the type of sort to do. Change the background to gray for easiness on the eyes. Restrict resizing so nothing in the window gets clipped. Clean up the overall look of the UI.

Create a main object. Create an AppWindow object and plug in the main object so that they can communicate with each other. The main object will handle the instances of windows (if in the future we want multiple instance support).
Add comments to the methods that make sense, and create a toString() method that only returns the name of the class.

Create a Screen class to handle returning the screen size dimensions. This way it's easy to call "Screen.width" instead of the entire Toolkit code. Mainly, make this an easy way to get the screen size.
Update workspace.xml (IntelliJ handles this)

- Add main variable to the class. - Add currentBarGraph variable to the list - Add Spinner constants for min/max/default - Set JSpinner to default value upon instantiation of the AppWindow class - Add a bunch of action listeners with a matching method which tells it what to do when the actionListener is triggered. - Create addBarGraphToBarPanel method which clears the existing graphics on the screen, adds a new bar graph, and then revalidates and repaints the barPanel. - Create refreshBarWidth method which updates the width of the bars to match the AppWindow size after it detects a resizing event.
- Add a width parameter to the constructor so that the width of the bars can be resized. - Refactored pBar to bar inside paintComponent method starting on line 25
- Add javadoc comments to all methods. - Change generateNewBarGraph method to set the bar width to a size calculated from the size of the appWindow.getBarPanel.width()
Shift the actionListeners around to make it look neater.

Add setClip() method to not crop the bar graphics in the bar graph. Before, there was an issue where the bars were getting cropped at the very edge of them, so the outline was not displaying properly.
Change the color outline from white to light gray.
Change the roundness of the bar graph from 10 to 14. It gives it a more rounded look.

Remove an import: javax.swing.event.ChangeListener. This is because javax.swing has a wildcard already.
Add set title to the JFrame.
Ln 155-156: Set X/Y positions so that the bars display properly on the JPanel.
Ln 158-159: Change calls to revalidate and repaint from JPanel barPanel to -> mainPanel. Reason: Instead of updating just the barPanel, it calls to update the entire mainPanel to reduce any visual oddities that were happening.
Remove unneeded lines in refreshBarWidth(). This is because the method was getting too complicated. It's now handled elsewhere.
Fix the bars resizing height problem.
Make the Next Button work, and make the previous button work.
Make the Quicksort class return the full Array of an Array
Create an abstract class Sorter that must implement the method called sort()
Add BogoSort

Add sortTypeComboBoxAction() method. Reason: When the user selects a new sort type, it clears the bar graph graphic to avoid buggy behavior, such as generating a new graph then changing the sort type.
Create new method displayInfoMessage(). Reason: When bogosort is selected the list may never get sorted completely, so after 10,000 tries, the dialog window pops up stating a different message.
Change displayInfoMessage method to include an extra overloaded method.
Create platform specific package
Add Insertion Sort Algorithm and fixed a minor bug with the JOptionPane
Add play button functionality It plays the animation and testing the other buttons while it plays works as intended

MESSAGE.value: Rename from Window.java/Window.form to AppWindow.java/AppWindow.form. Add JComboBox for new feature: Choosing the type of sort to do. Change the background to gray for easiness on the eyes. Restrict resizing so nothing in the window gets clipped. Clean up the overall look of the UI.

Create a main object. Create an AppWindow object and plug in the main object so that they can communicate with each other. The main object will handle the instances of windows (if in the future we want multiple instance support).
Add comments to the methods that make sense, and create a toString() method that only returns the name of the class.

Create a Screen class to handle returning the screen size dimensions. This way it's easy to call "Screen.width" instead of the entire Toolkit code. Mainly, make this an easy way to get the screen size.
Update workspace.xml (IntelliJ handles this)

- Add main variable to the class. - Add currentBarGraph variable to the list - Add Spinner constants for min/max/default - Set JSpinner to default value upon instantiation of the AppWindow class - Add a bunch of action listeners with a matching method which tells it what to do when the actionListener is triggered. - Create addBarGraphToBarPanel method which clears the existing graphics on the screen, adds a new bar graph, and then revalidates and repaints the barPanel. - Create refreshBarWidth method which updates the width of the bars to match the AppWindow size after it detects a resizing event.
- Add a width parameter to the constructor so that the width of the bars can be resized. - Refactored pBar to bar inside paintComponent method starting on line 25
- Add javadoc comments to all methods. - Change generateNewBarGraph method to set the bar width to a size calculated from the size of the appWindow.getBarPanel.width()
Shift the actionListeners around to make it look neater.

Add setClip() method to not crop the bar graphics in the bar graph. Before, there was an issue where the bars were getting cropped at the very edge of them, so the outline was not displaying properly.
Change the color outline from white to light gray.
Change the roundness of the bar graph from 10 to 14. It gives it a more rounded look.

Remove an import: javax.swing.event.ChangeListener. This is because javax.swing has a wildcard already.
Add set title to the JFrame.
Ln 155-156: Set X/Y positions so that the bars display properly on the JPanel.
Ln 158-159: Change calls to revalidate and repaint from JPanel barPanel to -> mainPanel. Reason: Instead of updating just the barPanel, it calls to update the entire mainPanel to reduce any visual oddities that were happening.
Remove unneeded lines in refreshBarWidth(). This is because the method was getting too complicated. It's now handled elsewhere.
Fix the bars resizing height problem.
Make the Next Button work, and make the previous button work.
Make the Quicksort class return the full Array of an Array
Create an abstract class Sorter that must implement the method called sort()
Add BogoSort

Add sortTypeComboBoxAction() method. Reason: When the user selects a new sort type, it clears the bar graph graphic to avoid buggy behavior, such as generating a new graph then changing the sort type.
Create new method displayInfoMessage(). Reason: When bogosort is selected the list may never get sorted completely, so after 10,000 tries, the dialog window pops up stating a different message.
Change displayInfoMessage method to include an extra overloaded method.
Create platform specific package
Add Insertion Sort Algorithm and fixed a minor bug with the JOptionPane
Add play button functionality It plays the animation and testing the other buttons while it plays works as intended
